bibl.title: Letter of the queen Helena to Papa bar Aggai

div.p: This text is a born-digital edition of the Letter of the queen Helena to Papa bar Aggai. The letter is part of a corpus of eight letters representing the correspondence of Papa bar Aggai, early 4th-century bishop of Seleucia, with some exponents of the western political and religious power. Beside the Letter of the queen Helena to Papa, the corpus includes: a letter from Eusebius of Rome to Papa, a letter from Judah Kyriakos bishop of Jerusalem to Papa, a letter from Papa to the Empress Helena, a letter from Jacob bishop of Nisibis to Papa, a letter from Ephrem to Papa, a letter from Papa to the citizens of Nisibis, the letter sent by the Western Fathers on the illegal removal of Papa.
This edition is based on the following manuscript witnesses:
Rome, Vatican Library, Borg. Sir. 82, f. 115r/v (B);
Trichur, Chaldean Syrian Church, APSTCH THRI 65, f. 48v (A) (the manuscript has been digitized, and it can be viewed here);
Baghdad, Chaldean Catholic Church. Patriarchate of Baghdad 377, f. 13r/v (C) (the manuscript has been digitized, and it can be viewed here).
This text has never been published in any prior edition.
This edition should not be considered as definitive but as a still in-progress material.

There is an old German translation of the entire corpus (based on the Syriac text preserved in ms Borg. Sir. 82) in O. Braun, "Der Briefwechsel des Katholikos Papa von Seleucia. Ein Beitrag zur Geschichte der ostsyrischen Kirche im vierten Jahrhundert", Zeitschrift für katholische Theologie 18 (1894), pp. 163-182, 546-565.
An English translation is provided along with the Syriac text.
This edition is an outcome of the Marie Skłodowska-Curie Global Fellowship 2022 – Project "ForM - FORGED MEMORIES: the Church of Late Antique Iran and the West", funded by the European Commission.

ܠܪܒ ܟܗ̈ܢܐ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ ܘܢܘܣܐ ܕܟܝܐ: ܒܝܬ ܡܫܪܝܐ ܕܪܘܚܐ ܕܩܘܕܫܐ ܡܪܐ ܕܝܠܝ ܡܪܝ ܦܵܦܵܐ ܦܛܪܝܪܟܝܣ ܕܡܕܢܚܐ : ܐܡܬܟ ܗܹܠܹܢܐ ܒܬܟܫܦܬܐ ܣܓܕܬܐ ܠܪ̈ܓܠܝܟ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܬܐ ܡܩܪܒܐ. ܡܢܐ ܐܦܪܘܥ ܠܡܪܝܐ ܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܦܘܪ̈ܥܵܢܘܗܝ ܥܠܝ. ܕܐܢ̄ܬܬܐ ܚܛܝܬܐ ܕܐܟܘܬܝ܆ ܠܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܘܟܗ̈ܢܐ ܕܐܟܘܬܟܘܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܘܣܹܩܪܐܣ ܒܦܪܗܣܝܐ ܬܟܬܘܒ ܘܬܫܕܪ. ܝܸܠܦܸܬ ܡܪܝ ܡܼܢ ܠܒܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܕܘܝܕ ܕܐܡ̇ܪ: ܕܐܫܒܚ ܠܡܪܝܐ
M1 35v ܒܚܝܝ̈: ܘܐܙܡܪ ܠܐܠܗܝ ܥܕ ܩܝܵܡ ܐ̄ܢܐ. ܐܦ ܐܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܪܲܢܹܬܼ ܒܢܦܫܝ܆
B 115v/230 ܕܟܕ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܠܗܕܐ ܟܠܗܿ ܪܒܘܬܐ ܩܪܼܐ ܠܢ܆ ܘܠܒܪܟ ܩܘܣܛܢܬܝܢܘܣ ܝܗܼ̄ܒ ܠܗ ܙܟܘܬܐ ܥܠ ܟܠܗܘܢ
B om ܒܥܠܕܒܒܘ̈ܗܝ : ܒܚܝܠܐ ܘܒܥܘܕܪܢܐ܆ ܒܢܝܫܗ ܪܒܐ ܕܨܠܝܒܐ ܕܒܓܠܝܢܗ ܕܡܼܢ ܫܡܝܐ ܐܣܬܚܸܦ
B ܐܣܬܿܚܸܦܘ ܡܫܪ̈ܝܬܐ ܕܒܥܠܕܒܒ̈ܐ. ܘܐܬܬܪܝܡܬܸ ܩܪܢܗܿ ܕܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ܆ ܨܵܒܝܐ ܐ̄ܢܐ ܕܐܦ ܐܢܐ ܐܘܪܒ ܫܡܗ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ ܒܟܠ ܐܬܿܪ ܒܥܕܬ̈ܐ ܕܒܲܢܝܐ ܐ̄ܢܐ. ܘܒܗܕܪܐ ܘܲܒܨܒܬܐ ܕܬܨܒ̈ܝܬܐ ܒܟܠ ܙܢܝܢ̈ . ܘܒܬܫܡܫܬܐ ܙܗܝܬܐ ܕܟܗ̈ܢܐ :
M3 104r ܘܒܩܘܒܠܐ ܕܣܢܝ̈ܩܐ ܆ ܗܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܕܐܝܿܕܐ ܗ̄ܝܼ ܕܥܵܕܪܐ ܠܡܣܥܪ ܒܦܢܝܬܟܘܢ܆ ܘܒܟܡܐ ܡܕܝ̈ܢܬܐ ܦܩܚܐ ܠܡܒܢܐ. ܘܐܢ ܐܝܬ ܡܥܲܟܪܢܐ ܘܐܢ ܠܝܬ. ܥܠ ܗܠܝܢ ܠܚܛܝܘܬܝ ܒܟܬܝ̈ܒܬܟ ܢܬܝܕܥ. ܒܐܝܼܕܐ
C 13v ܕܒܪܟ ܘܬܠܡܝܕܟ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܲܢܨܝܒܝܢ. ܘܨܿܠܐ ܥܠܝܢ ܘܥܠ ܒܪܟ ܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܘܣ ܡܠܟܐ ܘܥܠ ܟܠܗܿ ܡܕܒܪܢܘܬܗ ܕܒܨܠܘܬ̈ܟ ܬܸܨܠܚ ܒܟܠ ܥܒܼܕ ܛܒ ܘܡܫܲܠܡܢ.
[Letter] of the queen Helena to Papa

How shall I recompense the Lord of all his gifts [given] to me, that a sinful woman like me with parrhesia can write and send letter and sacra (i.e. imperial rescripts) to saints and priests like you. I have learned, my lord, from David, the [man after] God’s own heart, who said: I will glorify the Lord with my life, and I will sing to my God as long as I exist (cf. Ps 146, 2). My lord, I have meditated as well within myself that as Christ designated all this greatness for us and gave my son Constantine victory over all his enemies, through [his] power and aid, and through his great sign of the Cross that [was] in a revelation that [he had] from the sky that the enemy armies were defeated, and through the horn of the holy Church was exalted, I desire as well to make great the name of Christ in every land through the churches that I build, and through the honor and the decoration of adornments in every way, with the honorable liturgical office of the priests and the hospitality for the poor. Now, my lord, inform me, a sinner, in your writings, through your son and disciple the holy Jacob bishop of Nisibis whether there is anything useful [I could] to provide in your region, or how many churches would be advantageous to build, and whether there is anything that impedes or this or not. And pray for us, and for my son, the king Constantine, and for his entire government, that, through your prayers, he may greatly and fully prosper in everything he does.
